item.title: Yellen Doubts Biden Administration Can Avoid Default Without Congress
item.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said it was “legally questionable” whether the Biden administration could rely on the 14th Amendment to effectively ignore the debt limit.

item.title: Metals Slip Ahead of US Producer Price Inflation Data
item.description: Base metals prices were close to 2% lower in London, with gold futures slightly weaker, as the dollar strengthened, and as traders looked to today’s PPI data, after Wednesday’s CPI print pointed to a softening in headline inflation.

item.title: BOE Decision Seen Having Contained Impact on Sterling
item.description: The BOE interest-rate decision is unlikely to be a game changer for sterling, ING said, a 25bp rise is fully priced in for Thursday’s decision.

item.title: Takeda's Fiscal-Year Profit Rose Sharply
item.description: Takeda Pharmaceutical’s fiscal-year net profit jumped, mainly thanks to solid growth in its key business areas.

item.title: Honda Motor Profit Fell on Weaker China Sales, Higher Costs
item.description: Honda Motor said fourth-quarter net profit fell 10% from a year earlier owing to a drop in China car sales and higher costs.

item.title: Rolls-Royce Trading as Expected, Strategic Review Progressing
item.description: Rolls-Royce said its financial performance for the year to date was in line with expectations and that the strategic review of the group was on track, with the details, together with medium term targets, due in the second half of this year.

item.title: Pro Take: Can Nickel, Cobalt and Other Battery Metals Be Sourced Sustainably?
item.description: Worries over environmental destruction from Indonesian nickel are being used to build the case for extracting resources from the seabed.

item.title: SoftBank Group Posts $7.2B Loss, Hit by Tech Funds Woes
item.description: SoftBank Group posted a fiscal-year net loss as losses from its technology funds business offset gains from the unwinding of its stake in Alibaba Group.

item.title: Bayer Sees Guidance at Lower End of Range
item.description: Bayer posted lower first-quarter earnings, with results weighed by inflation and an impairment loss due to weaker glyphosate prices, and cautioned that it expected to meet the lower end of its 2023 guidance range

item.title: German Schatz Yield Has Upside Potential, Natixis Says
item.description: The short end of the curve, particularly the German Schatz, has an upside potential of 30 basis points by the end of the quarter, according to Natixis, which sees the recent rally as excessive.

item.title: Thyssenkrupp Profits Hit by Costs But Top Forecasts
item.description: Thyssenkrupp reported a 74% drop in underlying earnings to €205 million, with second-quarter results hit by lower orders and high energy and raw-material costs.

item.title: Hapag-Lloyd Backs Outlook Despite Weaker Demand, Rates
item.description: Hapag-Lloyd confirmed its 2023 outlook after it reported sharply lower first-quarter results, including underlying earnings of $2.4 billion, as the market normalized with declines in demand and freight rates.

item.title: Telefonica Outlook on Track as Earnings Top Hopes
item.description: Telefonica said it expected to meet its financial objectives for 2023 after it reported above-forecast earnings in the first quarter including 1.1% growth in Oibda

item.title: ING Launches Buyback After First-Quarter Beat
item.description: ING posted a net profit above expectations in the first quarter on a 21% rise in total income and lower provisions, and announced a €1.5 billion share buyback.

item.title: Merck KgaA Cautious on Outlook as Profits Fall
item.description: Germany’s Merck warned of negative impacts this year including likely declining Covid-19-related sales and chip market uncertainty, as it reported lower first-quarter earnings and targeted Ebitda pre in the range of €6.1-€6.7 billion

item.title: RWE Renewables Helped Boost First Quarter
item.description: RWE said its investment in renewable energy helped drive earnings higher, as it confirmed first-quarter results and again backed its outlook for the full year.

item.title: Coca-Cola Trials Turning Hard-to-Recycle Plastic Into Bottles
item.description: Coke’s biggest European bottler is backing a new technology that makes food-grade plastic out of landfill-bound waste.

item.title: China's Consumer Inflation Slows to Lowest in Two Years
item.description: The price weakness is likely to raise questions about the sustainability of the country’s consumer rebound.

item.title: FTSE 100 Seen Opening Higher Ahead of BOE Decision
item.description: The FTSE 100 is seen opening slightly higher as traders look ahead to the BOE interest rate decision later.

item.title: Work-Life Balance Is Their Second Priority. Work Is Their First.
item.description: Young professionals say they admire people who carve out personal time, then fail to do the same for themselves.
